title: Best sticky chai of the region!
text:
We love a chai latte but were only finding powder chai until we found this little gem!
Worth a visit!

title: Beautiful restaurant.
text: We visited this on a recommendation from a local and we were not disappointed. Must book though as it is very popular with the locals. Thoroughly enjoyed our 3 course delight. It’s a bonus that you can byo your wine from your purchases from cellar door shopping (although the corkage is $25!)

title: Chocolate and wine flight!!
text: If you are in the area this is a must do. For only $12pp this wine and chocolate pairing flight is sensational.

title: Highlight of the Clare!
text:
Can totally understand why this winery received the James Halliday award for best winery in 2020! Exceptional experience and fabulous wines and service. We absolutely
loved our visit, not to mention we walked out with a dozen wines to add to our collection!!

title: Great service and lovely grounds
text:
We visited here 8 years ago and wanted to come back again! Fortunately they squeezed our visit in at the end of the day but by no means were we rushed. The stories and time taken were a delight.
Loved the partnered wines the best.
Stunning grass areas for picnics too.

title: The best experience!
text: We were recommend to go here and had no real expectations, however our visit blew us away. Brittany served us and she was a delight. The wines here are all fabulous - it was hard to chose what to buy to take home! We will be back and I can say this is a must visit- a real hidden gem!!

title: Wonderful Experience
text: We had heard of this winery but didn’t know much about the wines. The tasting experience was incredible. Priscilla served us and was extremely generous with her knowledge and time. On this trip we visited many cellar doors and this was in the top 3! Highly recommend visiting.

title: Gorgeous food and very friendly staff
text: Gorgeous food and very friendly staff. We sat inside, however the outdoor area looked great. Perfect food to share and we loved every dish. The cakes were amazing!

title: Mr Mick perfect tapas lunch!
text: Mr Mick was suggested to us when visiting a Clare Valley cellar door and it was sensational. All dishes were so tasty and the flavours shone through on each dish. Highly recommend for tapas style eating. The outside area is stunning under the trees.

title: Wonderful location and facilities
text: Extremely happy with the park. Fabulous service and the best shower! We even got choice for our powered site. Great pressure and hot. The bathroom facilities are clean and well cared for. We stayed for 10 nights and it was ideal to travel and see the Barossa and Clare Valley wine regions.

title: Fabulous service and food
text: Great regional pub. Well priced and staff are supper friendly and can’t do enough for you. The food was lovely. Supper tasty and large portion sizes. Worth a visit with gas log fires for the winter months.

title: Nice and new but that’s all
text:
Although the room had everything we needed and an amazing shower and comfy bed, the room needed a good clean. It was extremely dusty and the bathroom hadn’t been cleaned thoroughly.
The heater worked really well and it was good for a self contained room.

title: Great hotel for corporate stays
text:
I stayed here for 3 nights and found it perfect. It has everything you need. I like the idea of the cafe to get breakfast on the go. The gym is small but has the basics.
The service was great and the bed was comfortable. Will be staying here again.
place: The William Inglis Hotel - MGallery by Sofitel

title: Fabulous service and food
text:
We were looking at many menus along this strip and we decided to dine here as the staff were genuinely friendly and fun.
The food was beautiful very reasonably priced.
The complimentary dessert and ouzo was a lovely gesture and ended a fine dinner experience.

title: Go in and look!
text:
Although you can see most of this from the outside it is well worth going in.
Don’t miss any chance to experience ancient ruins to understand incredible
times full of innovation, astounding creativity and engineering. Truely marvellous and worth the time to explore.

title: Walking in histroy
text:
We visited the first Sunday of the month in November which happened to be a free day. We didn’t plan it that way but it saved us €20.
There were still plenty of visitors but it was completely manageable. Just need some patience if you are wanting to take a photo in some spots.
It was amazing to see what was at the top but also around the slopes. Be sure to allow enough time to walk all around- don’t just go to the top. There is so much history to be taken in.
The restoration work is incredible and I am thrilled to see such dedication to allow these sites to be available for future generations.

title: Perfect for everything!
text:
This hotel is perfect on all accounts-
Staff are super friendly and helpful
Rooms are clean, modern and have all you need
The location is perfect for all the major sights
Easy to get to from the airport
Loads of places to eat and shop all in short walking distance
Highly recommend staying here. 10/10!!

title: Mind blown!!
text:
Wow, talk about amazing history. This is well laid out and easy to walk around. I was in awe of the history and impressed by all it had to offer. Try and avoid times when tours go through as big groups hover around areas and it makes it difficult to see and read the details. We found that the larger groups went in the morning. Also go to the toilet before hand as there were large queues (for male and female) when the tour groups are in.
It was easy to get to and from by bus - cheaper to buy your bus tickets from the machines rather than from the driver.

title: Still worth a visit
text:
Although there is scaffolding at the moment for the Acropolis, the stadium and amphitheatre are worth a look.
It is hot out there but plenty of shade to rest in.
We walked from old town and it didn’t take long. There is plenty of parking if you drive.

title: Can’t get enough of this spot
text:
We staying in Chania for 3 nights and really didn’t leave the Old Town and harbour area. It was ideal to stroll around the shops, eat at the many restaurants, sit and have a drink along the water. Explore the streets and laneways and take photos.
Very relaxing way to spend the end of our 3 week Greek Island hopping adventure.

title: Brilliant display of history
text: This is a place well worth a visit. Not only do you get to roam around the palace, the history within the walls are amazing. Allow enough time to stroll through to appreciate all it has to offer.
place: Palace of the Grand Master of the Knights of Rhodes

title: Incredible food
text:
We were recommended to dine here from our hotel and we are glad we did. We sat in the garden area which is delightful. All our dishes were divine and the local wine was amazing. Although a little more expensive it was well worth it.
The goat dish was so tender and the homemade ravioli melted in your mouth.
Highly recommend this restaurant.

title: Quaint stunning hotel
text:
This hotel is a real gem! Fabulous location, amazing breakfast and the service is exceptional. We stayed in the room with the hot tub which was in a private courtyard. Perfect for a romantic visit to Rethymno.
The room has all you need and is as their pictures show.
A delightful stay.

title: Amazing location & staff
text:
Eleni and her father are extremely generous and gracious hosts. The location of the hotel is perfect- just off the main square, walking distance to everything.
Our room was stunning and super clean.
A must stay hotel.
Thank you to our hosts for such a wonderful stay in Rhodes.

title: Must do walk!
text:
The hike from Fira to Oia is worth the 11km journey. Be sure to wear a hat, sunscreen and good walking shoes. Take water as there isn’t much shade.
Lots of photo opportunities along the way. Best to do Fira to Oia rather than the other way around.

title: Beautiful area
text:
Well worth the walk down and up again. Great swimming spots around the corner. Just need to walk through the rocks to get there.
We didn’t eat down here but the restaurants were all busy and the food looked great. I would dare say that this is the place for seafood lovers.
A great place to just sit and soak it all up!

title: Volcano visit
text: We booked the 3hr trip to the volcano island and hot springs. It was a beautiful boat ride. We didn’t swim but plenty of others did and enjoyed it. The volcano is a sight to see. Not only the volcano itself but the views looking back to Santorini are amazing!!

title: Great hotel
text: We loved our stay. Amazing host, great location, lovely breakfast and clean rooms. Everything has been thought of here and we felt like we were staying at a major hotel with all the trimmings but we were at a boutique hotel where you are remembered and known. Just a short stroll to the Three Bells, Fira centre - it is a perfect location.

title: Worth a visit
text: Great photo opportunity and worth checking out these old windmills. It can get busy even in the non summer months but as it is so close to the centre to town you can visit when it suits.

title: Lovely hotel
text:
We had a lovely 3 night stay here. The staff are amazing and extremely helpful.
The bed was super comfortable. It is a great location, just be prepared for a walk up a steep hill to get to the hotel. Don’t let this discourage you from staying there as it is worth it. Great views from the top!

title: Best location
text: This hotel is right near the port when you get off the ferry and a few steps to the square and the bus station. Despite the location it is quiet. Very comfortable and clean. Highly recommend this hotel. The only thing that caught me out was there was no hair dryer in the room.

title: Great food!
text:
We love our Thai and was really surprised with this find in a small town like Torquay.
Fabulous Thai flavours and fast service. Lovely atmosphere.

title: Great for GF options
text: We spent the weekend in Torquay and visited this cafe for lunch and brunch. I am gluten intolerant and this cafe had so many options. Highly recommend. Their GF toastier was outstanding as is their chai latte.

title: Go on an empty stomach!
text: This is the ideal place to experience Thai food at its best. Allow enough time to browse as there is so much to see and take in. Very cheap food, although the non food stalls are the same as you see in most tourist areas. This is a must to experience the food and eat your way around the market!!

title: Worth seeing!
text: This is well worth taking the time to visit. A must see when in Phuket! Be sure to explore the views and take in all it has to offer.

title: Best resort
text:
We have now stayed here 4 times since Oct 2015. This is the perfect place to relax and unwind. It has everything you need from pools, to the beach, great food and outstanding service where every little detail
Is thought of.

title: Delicious food and great location
text: Wonderful Thai food & attentive service. Well worth the money, as it is a lot more than the other restaurants in the same strip.

title: Breathtaking!
text:
Wow what a visit to the super pit! This is a Kalgoorlie must do.
Dan our bus driver was entertaining and a wealth of knowledge. He explained everything from the equipment, stats and even history and the gold extraction process.
We both loved this adventure!!

title: What a find!!
text:
We were recommended to try this and it was well worth it. I don't drink beer but my husband tried 3 of the taster paddle and loved them all.
It is not easy to find but don't let that stop you from taking the time to visit this little gem!

title: Awesome stay!
text:
This is a wonderful caravan park. The facilities are great, clean and designed so it is very social. Only a short walk to the bus stop to take you right into central Perth (takes about 30mins) and the buses are very frequent.
On Friday night there was an acoustic guitarist and a dessert van! Yummy ice cream and Greek deserts.
Although it is close to the airport, you really don't hear the planes.
Will stay here again.

title: What an experience!!
text:
The best way to get to Rottnest! This was a highlight of our trip. I was worried about such a small plane but it was extremely smooth- taking off, flying and landing.
As you aren't so high up, the views of the island and the water are incredible.
Our pilot Jarrad pointed out the great places to see on the island and showed us where the seals normally are. Very spoilt.
Loved this experience!!

title: Enjoyable visit
text:
I must say that I wasn't excited about going here but my husband really wanted to see Australia ll.
To my surprise, I am pleased to say that I really enjoyed it. There is so much to learn and is a great deal of reading but you can stroll through at your leisure.
The information of the defence forces I found of particular interest.
A great outing for all ages.

title: Average for the price
text:
When you are visiting Fremantle it makes sense to have fish and chips! Unfortunately, we were disappointed with the serving sizes considering the price.
Great location and heaps of seating both inside and out.

title: Best cruise ever!
text:
This was just what we wanted. A cruise along the Swan River and this was the best way to do it. Bob our captain was very knowledgable of the history of the river which was fascinating. He is a very friendly chap!
The little Cove at Claisebrook was stunning and well worth a walk around and visit to one of the bars/restaurants.
We thought the price was cheap considering it was only $22 return pp.
A must do in Perth.

title: Stunning!
text: Had a great visit here at Lake Cave. Karen was a fabulous tour guide. Well worth a visit if you are in the region.

title: Lunch
text: Beautiful food! Fabulous service from Chloe who was ever so helpful and knowledgable. We selected from the A la carte menu but the 5 course degustation also looked amazing! Don't miss this.

title: Wedding Anniversary celebration
text: We visited to celebrate our 20th wedding anniversary. We had the 6 course degustation lunch and it was sensational! The wine and food matching was perfect and you couldn't fault the service. Sean, our waiter was a great character and went above and beyond to ensure our experience was memorable. We will visit again. Such a wonderful day and memory to have.

title: Expensive for what you get
text: We stayed for 2 nights and although the park is situated in a great spot and the grounds are amongst an ideal setting in the bush, the bathroom facilities are terrible. Not clean at all and very outdated. We assumed they hose it out and that's it. We have stayed at many caravan parks and never paid $48per night full stop let along get such terrible amenities. Would not stay again. Worth driving a little further or camping in the National Park.

title: Well worth the experience!
text: This is an amazing attraction, a must see if you are in the area. We loved it. The tram driver was extremely knowledgable and very pleasant.

title: Stunning!
text: Well worth a visit and stay. This place is spectacular. We didn't use the solar showers they had there as we used our own so I can't comment but the toilets were very clean. The hosts were fabulous. The walks and views are amazing. Can't wait to go again!

title: Best Shower ever!!
text:
We stayed here in a powered site with our camper van for one night. We had been free camping for two nights and having a hot, high pressure shower was bliss!! It surely beat our outside shower.
If you are staying multiple nights, try and get a site away from the wall of the highway.
Would stay again.

title: Wonderful weekend escape!
text:
My husband and I wanted a relaxing weekend away and this was the perfect place. We left the car in the car park all weekend and walked everywhere- the location is ideal. We stayed in the 'Vue' room and it was just what we wanted. The only thing that could be improved is the lighting in the bathroom. Very very hard to put makeup on in the light that was provided.
Breakfast is part of the package and the a la carte choices in the cafe is amazing!!
This the perfect couple getaway!!

title: Most comfortable bed in Scotland!
text:
We stayed in the White room and it was exactly as the picture. The bed was extremely comfortable and everything was perfect. Breakfast was amazing and cooked to order.
Debbie was an exceptional host. We could not recommend this place highly enough. The photo below is the stunning view from our bedroom window.

title: Great food & atmosphere
text: We were after a traditional Scottish pub and this didn't disappoint. A must visit if you are in the area. Loved the fact that the locals could take their dogs inside. This might sound odd to some but it added to the character.

title: Good location & value for money but.....
text: If you like a comfortable bed don't sleep here. The bed was hard and lumpy and the walls are paper thin. Not at all what you want after flying from Australia. Despite this, the room was very clean & the staff on the front desk were all extremely helpful.
place: Point A Hotel, London Kings Cross St Pancras

title: A must see!
text: If you are visiting York this is well worth the trip. The house & grounds are stunning. Be sure to take advantage of the free tours.

title: Authentic thai food in Melbourne!
text: Finally we have found a restaurant that reflects our holiday to Thailand. Beautiful food, lovely service and a fine atmosphere.

title: Perfect stay!
text: My husband & I were wanting a relaxing holiday at a beach side resort. We got what we wanted & more. The attention to detail & warm friendly staff were such a pleasure. The choice of pools, quality restaurants and bars made it a wonderful stay. The choice of outside restaurants only a few steps away were all great & we went to some more than once. We will be booking again & really looking forward to another relaxing visit.
